p: The cytopathic effect of viruses elicits not merely brain inflammation, but intense brain inflammation with breakdown of the BBB, allowing further entrance of viruses; in addition, the repair mechanisms are restricted [ 2]. Due to the limited blood supply the brain depends more on cell than on humoral-mediated immunity. The interstitium is constantly patrolled by microglia and antigen presentation is weakly developed [ 2]. Apoptosis follows and the inflammation intensifies [ 2]. The cascade may further be complicated by autoimmune mediated mechanisms [ 13].
